meanings.definition: Having a higher intellect or intelligence than average.
meanings.sent1: She is brainier than most of her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The brainier students tend to excel in school.
meanings.sent3: His brainier approach to solving the puzzle impressed everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her brainier mind was like a shining beacon in the sea of mediocrity.
meanings.sent5: The brainier individuals in the group stood out with their insightful comments.

meanings.sent1: The brainier solution to the problem was simple yet effective.
meanings.sent2: Her brainier ideas always amazed her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The brainier approach to the game made it more enjoyable for everyone.
meanings.sent4: His brainier wit kept the conversation lively and engaging.
meanings.sent5: The brainier design of the building impressed all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A person who is more intelligent than others.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the brainier in the research team.
meanings.sent2: The brainier always had innovative solutions to problems.
meanings.sent3: The brainier in the group made everyone laugh with their clever jokes.
meanings.sent4: He was the brainier in the room, always coming up with brilliant ideas.
meanings.sent5: The brainier was sought after for advice due to their sharp intellect.
